Career Profile

A polyglot Senior Software Engineer with over 20 years experience, working in diversified markets as Online Gambling, Automotive and Health Care.

Currently working for Kindred as a Senior Java Developer, helping to design, implement, test and deploy solutions for Marketing Campaigns. Strong focus on using the best industry practices in development with a Domain-Driven Developemnt mindset, as adopting Agile Methodologies, Continuous Integration and Deployment, and a test-first approach.

Deep and broad understanding in designing and developing robust, scalable and high-performance microservices using core Java, Spring Boot and Cloud Computing Solutions.

I am a very proactive type of person, highly motivated and interested in both personal and professional development through continuous learning as well as coaching other engineers and building a strong team culture.

Experiences

Senior Software Enginner - Contract

June 2019 - March 2020 | London, UK
Kindred Group, Online Gambling Industry

Contract position in the Digital Marketing team to support and build new tools with the purpose of acquiring and retain online gambling users.

My main role responsibilities were mostly decoupling an existing monolith application (Campaign System) into microservices and working in greenfield projects to support new marketing campaigns:

  • Proposing, documenting and implementing architectural solutions as part of breaking a monolith into microservices and adding new features using a microservices architecture.
  • Working closely with the architectures while identifying potential solutions for new business requests. All proposed architecture designs follow the C4 model, Domain-Driven Design and a Hexagonal architecture (Port and Adaptors). All these proposals were successful signed off and translated into code. This allows us to build loose coupling, high cohesion and highly scalable microservices.
  • Mentoring, coaching and supporting team members. Advising the team on new tools and frameworks. A few examples of proposal tools such as Spring State Machine, Lombok vs AutoValue or AssertJ.

Projects:

  • Campaign Scheduler

    Microservice created during the breakdown of Campaign System to create a more robust and scalable approach to schedule the Start and End dates of recurrent campaigns. This is a Message-Driven microservice.

  • Campaign Orchestrator

    Orchestrator between several microservices involved during the send out of marketing campaigns. Based on internal rules, it can decided the flow of a campaign send out.

  • Operation Monitor Report

    Microservice used to gather reports of the health and status of a marketing campaign. It gathers data from several communication channels, errors, budget limits, etc, and based on business rules it can decide if a campaign must be suspended or stop. It’s also used to send warnings and reports on the current status of active campaigns.

technologies

Java 11, Spring Framework (Boot, Cloud, JDBC, State Machine), Microservices architectures and patterns, Relational databases and SQL, RESTful Services and design, Message-driven architecture, PubSub+, DDD, Docker, K8s, Unit Testing Frameworks, Git, Maven. Liquibase

Senior Software Enginner

August 2018 - May 2019 | Porto, PT
BMW Group - Critical Tech Work, Automotive Industry

  • Team Lead and part of the autonomous driving car project.

  • Responsible to design solutions and implement them, together with the team, using Java, Spring Framework and cloud technologies.

  • Focus on agility and increased business value, with a strong emphasis in test automation. Responsible to automate end-to-end business processes and software processes, applying Continuous Integration and Delivery, Infrastructure as Code, automating whenever possible to speed up the time to market while avoiding errors.

  • Modelling and best practices for a highly available architecture in the cloud, using Multi-Availability Zones and Multi Regions setup, with an active-active failover based on health metrics.

  • Technically coaching teams on Core Java, cloud technologies infrastructure automation to adopt a cloud native architecture, using Terraform and Packer in a CICD pipeline for a fully automated deployment.

  • Coaching junior members from internal teams, helping them on adopting core technologies at BMW.

technologies

Java 11, Spring Framework (Core, Boot 2.0, Vault, JMS, Transaction), Microservices, Fault Tolerance, RESTful Services and design, Message-driven architecture, Unit Testing Frameworks (JUnit, Hamcrest, Mockito, rest-assured, FitNesse), Git, Maven, Terraform, Docker, K8s, AWS (VPC, EC2, EKS, SQS, Secrets Manager, ECR)

Senior Software Enginner

March 2018 - July 2018 | London, UK
Kindred Group, Online Gambling Industry

Inserted into the DCS team - Digital Customer Support, my key responsibilities was to help the team to modernize the entire digital communication solution and make improvements on how Kindred communicates with its customers. My main focus during my time at Kindred was supporting the whole DCS microservice architecture, refactoring key projects to use spring boot and support the company to be GDPR compliance.

technologies

Senior Software Engineer

December 2012 - March 2018 | London, UK
Gamesys, Online Gambling Industry

As a Team Lead:

  • Effectively managing a team of five Java developers and one QA. Responsible for implementing team goals, individual objectives and proactively supporting the continuous development of team members by providing a clear and constructive feedback and creating opportunities for learning and growth.
  • Part of the recruitment process and responsible for training, mentoring and integrating new team members.
  • Accountable for the team’s response to live issues, ensuring they are resolved quickly and effectively, with status updates regularly communicated to stakeholders.

As a Lead Java Developer:

  • Design, implement and maintain several backend slots games and support existing old games. All the code is modular and well tested, following patterns and practices that exist across the wider Engineering community.
  • Exposure to multi-thread code, mainly when supporting parallel execution of Standard Expectation Tests and several asynchronous tasks for calculating special prize payments among players.
  • Supporting a new Slots Replay System capable of storing and playback all previous player’s’ actions within a slot game. This is a fully asynchronous system based on JMS, Apache Camel and RESTful services.
  • Oversee the technologies, tools and techniques used within the team and pushing them to adopt new frameworks and technologies.

Alert Job Scheduler

  • Architectural Designer and Lead Developer of a generic Job Scheduler Service. The service has the ability to create and schedule jobs that interact with remote services.

CRMServices - High Availability Environment

  • Lead Developer in the re-architecting of an application, able to schedule notifications to be send to customers (using several channels such as email, fax, SMS), enabling it to be executed in High Availability Environments.
